answers.author: Robert Cole
answers.text:
As noted in Ms. Moulder's post, the Village of Oak Park has integrated alternative fuels into our fleet, including:

CNG fueling station at our public works facility and CNG fleet cars
Limited use of E-85, including a couple of police vehicles
Up to 25% biodiesel in diesel vehicles (summer), plus traps being installed to reduce emmissions
Considering low-speed EVs for some needs, like parking enforcement

Best,
Rob

answers.author: Charles Warrington
answers.text:
The Clearwater Gas System (CGS) is working with our fleet operations at City of Clearwater, FL, to convert our 70 heavy duty solid waste, recycling, and roll-off vehicles to CNG as well as a number of our City & Gas System utility vehicles.  Clearwater Gas is building a CNG fueling station, which is targeted for completion in the Spring of 2011 & will also be available publicly for outside fleet & private NGV vehicles.  Our CGS contact on this is Brian Langille, P.E., Gas Operations Manager @ (727) 562-4911 or brian.langille@clearwatergas.com & our City Fleet contact is Rick Carnley, Asst. Director of General Services @ (727) 562-4891 or rick.carnley@myClearwater.com .  This CNG facility & several vehicles are targeted to be showcased next summer @ TLG 2011 in Clearwater, FL.
Additionally, there are several other Cities in FL which already have CNG stations & vehicles.  The best contact re these is Jeff Greene, Business Development Manager for Wise Gas, Inc. @ (954) 636-4291 or jeff@wisegasinc.com .  Note that we have just selected Wise Gas to construct our CGS CNG fueling station.

ICMA hosted a webinar on 9/16 called "Sustainable Communities: How Greening Up Your Fleet Results in Huge Cost Savings," with speakers as follows:  Rich Conrad, city manager of Mercer Island, Washington; Leslie Stanton (manages the Climate Protection and Transportation Planning Program for the Puget Sound Clean Air Agency); and Stephanie Meyn (coordinator for the Puget Sound Clean Cities Coalition).  I believe you can watch a 'on-demand' version of the webinar.

author: Katherine Woerner Caffrey
text:
Has anyone integrated the use of alternative fuels into their City's fleet? 
In particular, I am looking for a community with less than 150,000 population that has done an analysis on the various types of alternative fuels and then begun the integration of an alternative fuel or vehicle. thanks.
title: Use of Alternative Fuels in City Fleets
